SEARCH
Module PacMan
Package scripts

Class MatrixFromFileExtractor

java.lang.Object
scripts.MatrixFromFileExtractor
public class MatrixFromFileExtractor extends Object
The MatrixFromFileExtractor class is responsible for reading a file containing a matrix and converting it into a 2D string array. It also includes methods for debugging and converting data structures for matrix manipulation.
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Davide Di Stefano

  • Constructor Details

    • MatrixFromFileExtractor

      public MatrixFromFileExtractor()

  • Method Details

    • MatrixExtractor

      public static String[][] MatrixExtractor(String filepath)
      Extracts a matrix from a specified file and converts it into a 2D string array. Each row of the file represents a row in the matrix, with values separated by spaces.
      Parameters:
      filepath - the file path of the matrix data source(Strings separated by spaces)
      Returns:
      a 2D string array representing the extracted matrix.

    • deepCopy

      public static String[][] deepCopy(String[][] originalGameMap)
      Creates a deep copy of a 2D array of strings. This method ensures that the copied array is independent of the original array, meaning that changes to the copy do not affect the original and vice versa. Useful to avoid to read a file more than once
      Parameters:
      originalGameMap - The 2D array of strings to be copied. Can be null.
      Returns:
      A new 2D array containing the same elements as the original, or null if the original is null.

    • convertToArrayOfArrays

      public static String[][] convertToArrayOfArrays(ArrayList<String[]> arrayList)
      Converts an ArrayList of string arrays into a 2D string array. This transformation ensures faster access and manipulation of matrix data.
      Parameters:
      arrayList - the ArrayList containing the matrix datas.
      Returns:
      a 2D string array containing the definitive matrix.

    • debugMatrixPrinter

      public static void debugMatrixPrinter(String[][] fasterGameMap)
      Prints the contents of the provided matrix for debugging purposes. Displays the matrix in a structured format followed by its object type.
      Parameters:
      fasterGameMap - the 2D string array representing the game map.

    • getGameMapCopy

      public static String[][] getGameMapCopy()
      Retrieves a deep copy of the original game map loaded from file. This allows the game board to be reset without re-reading the file.
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the original game map.
